title: Level 4 Measurement Practice Test
description: Test your skills with area, unit conversions, time, and money at the Level 4 standard.

questions.question: A rectangle is $7 \text{ cm}$ long and $4 \text{ cm}$ wide. What is its area?
How many centimetres are in $3 \text{ m } 50 \text{ cm}$?
questions.explanation: $3 \text{ m} = 3 \times 100 = 300 \text{ cm}$. Add the extra $50 \text{ cm}$: $300 + 50 = 350 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: A swimming lesson starts at $3\text{:}40$ pm and lasts for $45$ minutes. What time does it finish?
questions.explanation: From $3\text{:}40$, add $20$ minutes to reach $4\text{:}00$. That uses $20$ of the $45$ minutes, leaving $25$ minutes. $4\text{:}00 + 25 = 4\text{:}25$ pm.

questions.question: Which is heavier: $2{,}400 \text{ g}$ or $2.5 \text{ kg}$?
questions.explanation: Convert $2.5 \text{ kg}$ to grams: $2.5 \times 1{,}000 = 2{,}500 \text{ g}$. Since $2{,}500 > 2{,}400$, the $2.5 \text{ kg}$ is heavier.

questions.question: You buy items costing $\$3.20$, $\$4.55$, and $\$1.25$. What is the total cost?
A square has an area of $36 \text{ cm}^2$. What is the length of one side?
questions.explanation: A square's area $= \text{side} \times \text{side}$. Since $6 \times 6 = 36$, each side is $6 \text{ cm}$.

questions.question: Convert $4{,}750 \text{ mL}$ to litres. Write your answer using a decimal (e.g., 3.5).
questions.explanation: $4{,}750 \div 1{,}000 = 4.75 \text{ L}$. To convert millilitres to litres, divide by $1{,}000$.

questions.question: A football game starts at $1\text{:}50$ pm and goes for $1$ hour and $40$ minutes. What time does it end? Write your answer in the format like 3:30.
questions.explanation: From $1\text{:}50$, add $1$ hour to get $2\text{:}50$. Then add $40$ minutes: $2\text{:}50 + 10 = 3\text{:}00$, then $3\text{:}00 + 30 = 3\text{:}30$ pm.

questions.question: A rectangular playground is $12 \text{ m}$ long and $8 \text{ m}$ wide. What is its area in square metres?
You pay for a $\$7.60$ item with a $\$10$ note. How much change do you receive? Write your answer with a dollar sign (e.g., $2.50).
